docs.lead_paragraph: Millions of Americans live with macular degeneration, a leading cause of vision loss among older people, and Stargardt's disease, a similar condition that arises in late childhood. Stephen Rose, chief research officer for the Foundation Fighting Blindness, recently joined the Consults blog to answer reader questions about these retinal degenerative diseases. Here, Dr. Rose responds to reader questions about potential treatments for macular degeneration and Stargardt's disease that are currently under investigation.
docs.abstract: Stephen Rose of the Foundation Fighting Blindness responds to reader questions about treatments now under investigation for macular degeneration and Stargardt's disease.
docs.snippet: Stephen Rose of the Foundation Fighting Blindness responds to reader questions about treatments now under investigation for macular degeneration and Stargardt's disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: The president’s plan would increase payments for many beneficiaries, while some providers would receive less from the government.

headline.seo: Medicare and Medicaid Face $320 Billion in Cuts Over 10 Years
headline.main: Obama Proposes $320 Billion in Medicare and Medicaid Cuts Over 10 Years
headline.print_headline: Obama Proposes $320 Billion in Medicare and Medicaid Cuts Over 10 Years
